column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////Wait time wasn't bad
column2: but this may have had to do with the holiday and coming earlier in the evening (around 6pm). To be honest
column3: I'm not sure what to think of the interior and decor -- not sure if they are going for old school italian
column4: sports bar or dirty. Having lived in NYC
column5: we decided to try both the deep dish and the thin crust. The deep dish was NOT worth the 45 minute wait -- I'm not sure if the pizza had sat out for a while
column6: but it tasted like they had baked the crust
column7: sauce and cheese separately. Although fresh
column8: the pizza looked like it came out of a refrigerator.
